Package threading

Class RootFinder

java.lang.Object
threading.RootFinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class RootFinder extends Object implements Runnable
Class for computing the roots implementing runnable to allow for running on separate threads. Until the thread this object is on is shutdown, it will continue to compute 3-tuple sets placed into the inputBuffer. Results are sent to outputBuffer
See Also:
RootFinder

  • Constructor Details

    • RootFinder

      public RootFinder​(CircularBuffer<double[]> inputBuffer, CircularBuffer<RootData> outputBuffer)
      RootFinder constructor which initializes inputBuffer and outputBuffer to a provided shared buffer for each. Used to share workload between threads.
      Parameters:
      inputBuffer - Inputbuffer where 3-tuples are consumed to output roots
      outputBuffer - Outputbuffer where produced roots are added

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Run method comes from Runnable interface. This method is called on thread start which is handled by ExecutorService in our Master class.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • findRoots

      private Complex[] findRoots​(double[] array)
      Find roots from a 3-tuple array.
      Parameters:
      array - double array with size of 3, where index 0 represents a term, 1 represents b term, etc.
      Returns:
      The resulting two roots stored in a Complex object.
      See Also:
      Complex

    • findRoots

      private Complex[] findRoots​(double a, double b, double c)
      Takes inputs a,b, and c and outputs two complex Roots from these inputs.
      Parameters:
      a - a value of ax^2 + bx + c
      b - b value of ax^2 + bx + c
      c - c value of ax^2 + bx + c
      Returns:
      The two roots represented as Complex objects
      See Also:
      Complex
